You can have a lasting impact on this great University and help to shape the future of Purdue, the nation, and the world. Learn more by exploring the links at right.

What is an endowment?

Endowments are gifts held in perpetuity and invested in a manner that protects the principal from inflation. The investment income provides a stable funding source for such purposes as scholarships, professorships, lecture series, and research centers.

Purdue has received and managed hundreds of endowment gifts over the years. Collectively, these gifts make up the Purdue University Endowment.
